text: I'm with warmly yours our company has
been in business for about 11 years now
our market is the remodeling and new
construction market and as all of us
know and the end of 2008 approximately
october two thousand eight we had a bit
of a crash in the banking market
combined with a housing market crash and
then also combine that with consumer
confidence one of the things that i
noticed immediately that happened to our
team here at warmly yours during this
period of time was there was a lot of
fear a lot of uncertainty every day on
the news hundreds of thousands tens of
thousands of people were being cut by
major companies so this created a lot of
anxiety here at warmly yours and the
first thing I knew I had to do as a
leaders I needed to reassure everyone
that they were safe and that they could
trust me and the people around them to
get them through this recession Trust is
was a major part of Los crap done I can
talk about that but what was important
was making sure everyone wasn't living
fear-based so the first thing that I did
at warmly yours was I let my managers
and people know that there would be no
layoffs at warmly yours we were going to
get through this thing together no one
was going to be left behind sort of like
the what the school system does No Child
Left Behind no warmly yours employee
left behind I think that kind of helped
him you know I I believe there still was
a bit of uncertainty there about my
ability to execute on that but I think
it helped people immediately by giving
giving by letting them don't know that I
was not going to be making my decisions
based on a balance sheet where who can I
cut to make up for the sales that I'm
using right now as a result of this
recession so once we got through the
fear and trying to little to reduce that
minimize that
thing that I did was I took steps to
introduce a product that was
counter-cyclical to my core business my
core business is radiant heating indoor
radiant eating the season for that
starts in October ends in about May
indoor projects when it's cold outside
the product that I introduced to kind of
minimize my low season which is the
summer when everyone's out doing
construction outside not indoors is a
snowmelt and deicing product what this
allowed me to do is in my slowest months
gain additional incremental profits that
I would not have had in previous years
2009 was a year for me to execute that
because I knew my sales would suffer
greatly as a matter of fact they did my
sales dropped by thirty three percent
however I was able to add 80 thousand
dollars worth of profit to that summer
to help my company get through the
recession so for me the bottom line was
trust fear no fear and introducing a
product that helped to even out our
sales cycle bring an additional income
and that's how we got through the
recession
